items.stem: Which law forms the foundation of UK food safety?
options: Health and Safety at Work Act 1974
items.rationale: The Food Safety Act 1990 is the key UK food safety law.

options: Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Points
Hazard Awareness and Cleaning Control Plan
items.rationale: HACCP means Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Points.

items.stem: Which of the following is NOT one of the seven HACCP principles?
items.rationale: Marketing is not part of HACCP; the other options are principles.

options: Taking reasonable steps to avoid offences
Relying on the EHO to spot issues
items.rationale: Due diligence means taking all reasonable precautions and keeping evidence.

items.stem: What is traceability in food safety?
options: Tracking where food came from and where it goes
items.rationale: Traceability tracks food one step forward and one step back.
